googleMaps.question: Does ConvoyHub replace Google Maps?
googleMaps.answer: No. ConvoyHub is for planning and coordinating. When you need directions, a button opens Google Maps directly.

whoSeesMap.question: Who can see the live event map?
whoSeesMap.answer: All participants can see the event map with the route, stops, and rider locations. The organizer has an advanced view called 'Control Tower' with extra tools to coordinate the group.

privacy.question: How is privacy protected?
privacy.answer: Your location is only shared during the event and with your explicit consent. It auto-turns off when finished and you always have a visible 'Stop sharing' button. Outside active rides, there's no tracking. Ever.

multipleMotos.question: Can I have multiple bikes?
multipleMotos.answer: Yes. Add as many as you want and select the active one for each ride. This helps validate compatibility.

publicPrivate.question: Are there public and private rides?
publicPrivate.answer: Yes. Rides can be public (anyone can see), guild-only (members only), or by direct invitation.

guilds.question: How do guilds work?
guilds.answer: They're communities with roles: Founder, Officer, and Member. Each guild has its own rides and routes.

noSignal.question: What happens if I lose signal?
noSignal.answer: Others will see you're 'offline' with your last known location. When you regain signal, your location updates automatically.

paidRides.question: When will paid rides be available?
paidRides.answer: Coming soon. We're preparing rides with registration for organized tours and professional guides.

fakeReputation.question: How is fake reputation prevented?
fakeReputation.answer: You can only recommend or rate someone if you actually shared a ride. No exceptions.

addFriends.question: How do I add friends in ConvoyHub?
addFriends.answer: You can send friend requests from any rider's profile, or accept incoming ones. You can also add friends after sharing a ride — that's how you build a real trust network.

friendsLocation.question: Can my friends see my location?
friendsLocation.answer: Only if you allow it. You can share your approximate location (not exact) with friends you choose. This feature is optional and always controlled by you.

autonomy.title: Design autonomy
autonomy.description: This landing was designed with full creative freedom by Lovable, the design assistant. It was given autonomy to choose typography, spacing, components, visual direction, and interactions — always respecting the product message and the rider community's needs.
autonomy.note: This freedom is intentional: we believe the best experiences are born when design can breathe.
